conclusion: To determine the coefficient of kinetic friction μ₁ between the block and the plate, we need to analyze the forces and motion involved.
The block of mass m is placed on the plate of mass M = 2m.
The block experiences a frictional force due to the plate, given by f₁ = μ₁ mg.
The plate experiences a frictional force due to the horizontal surface, given by f₂ = μ₂ (M + m)g.
From Figure B, we can infer the acceleration of the block.
The block accelerates due to the frictional force f₁, so f₁ = ma.
The frictional force f₁ is also given by μ₁ mg.
Simplifying, we get μ₁ g = a.
From Figure B, we need to determine the slope of the velocity-time graph to find the acceleration a.
Suppose the graph shows a linear increase in velocity, and the slope (which is the acceleration) is a.
Using the relationship μ₁ g = a, we can solve for μ₁.
Given g = 10 m/s², we have μ₁ = a/g.
If the graph shows that the velocity increases linearly from 0 to v over time t, then a = v/t.
Suppose from the graph, a = 2 m/s².
The coefficient of kinetic friction μ₁ between the block and the plate is 0.2.
